briefdescription.para: Constructs a BDragger object from message data.

parameterdescription.para: The message data to restore from.

memberdef.argsstring: (BRect frame, BView *target, uint32 resizingMode=B_FOLLOW_NONE, uint32 flags=B_WILL_DRAW)
memberdef.name: BDragger

briefdescription.para: Creates a new BDragger and sets its target view.

detaileddescription.para: The target view must be its immediate relativea sibling, a parent, or single child, however, the constructor does not establish this relationship for you.

Once you construct the BDragger you must do one of of these:
Add the target as a child of the dragger.
Add the dragger as a child of the target.
Add the dragger as a sibling of the target.
If you add the target as a child of the dragger it should be its only child.

A BDragger draws in the right bottom corner of its frame rectangle. If the target view is a parent or a sibling of the dragger then the frame rectangle needs to be no larger than the handle. However, if the target is a child of the dragger then the dragger's frame rectangle must enclose the target's frame so that the dragger doesn't clip the target.

parameterdescription.para: The frame rectangle that the dragger is draw into.
The view to set the dragger to.
Sets the parameters by which the dragger can be resized. See BView for more information on resizing options.
The flags mask sets what notifications the BDragger can receive. See BView for more information on flags.

briefdescription.para: Destroys the BDragger object and frees the memory it uses, primarily from the bitmap handle.
Similar to AttachedToWindow() but this method is triggered after all child views have already been attached to a window.
Similar to AttachedToWindow() but this method is triggered after all child views have already been detached from a window.
Archives the draggers's relationship to the target view.

detaileddescription.para: The deep parameter has no effect on the BDragger object but is passed on to BView::Archive().

simplesect.para: A status code, typically B_OK or B_ERROR on error.

briefdescription.para: Puts the BDragger under the control of HideAllDraggers() and ShowAllDraggers().
Removes the BDragger from the control of HideAllDraggers() and ShowAllDraggers().
Draws the dragger handle.

parameterdescription.para: The rectangular area to draw the handle in.

briefdescription.para: Hook method called when the view is moved.

parameterdescription.para: The point of the top left corner of the frame that the view has been moved to.

briefdescription.para: Hook method called when the view is resized.

parameterdescription.para: The new width of the view.
The new height of the view.

briefdescription.para: Fill out the preferred width and height of the view into the _width and _height parameters.

detaileddescription.para: Derived classes should override this method to set the preferred size of object.

simplesect.para: Either the _width or _height parameter may be set to NULL if you only want to get the other one.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a float to store the width of the view.
Pointer to a float to store the height of the view.

detaileddescription.para: Reports the suites of messages and specifiers that derived classes understand.

briefdescription.para: Makes the view the current focus view of the window or gives up being the window's focus view.

detaileddescription.para: The focus view handles selections and KeyDown events when the the attached window is active. There can be only one focus view at a time per window.
When called with focus set to true this method first calls MakeFocus() on the previously focused view with focus set to false.

The focus doesn't automatically change when MouseDown() is called so calling MakeFocus() is the only way to make a view the focus view of a window. Classes derived from BView that can display the current selection, or that can accept pasted data should call MakeFocus() in their MouseDown() method to update the focus view of the window on click.
If the view isn't attached to a window this method has no effect.

parameterdescription.para: true to set focus, false to remove it.

briefdescription.para: Receives messages that control the visibility of the dragger handle.

parameterdescription.para: The message received

briefdescription.para: Hook method that is called when a mouse button is pressed over the dragger.

detaileddescription.para: This results in the archiving of the target view and the dragger and initiates a drag-and-drop operation.

parameterdescription.para: The point on the screen where to mouse pointer is when the mouse is clicked.

briefdescription.para: Hook method called when the mouse is moved.

parameterdescription.para: The new location of the mouse in the view's coordinate system.

One of the following:
B_ENTERED_VIEW The cursor has just entered the view.
B_INSIDE_VIEW The cursor is inside the view.
B_EXITED_VIEW The cursor has left the view's bounds. This only gets sent if the scope of the mouse events that the view can receive has been expanded by SetEventMask() or SetMouseEventMask().
B_OUTSIDE_VIEW The cursor is outside the view. This only gets sent if the scope of the mouse events that the view can receive has been expanded by SetEventMask() or SetMouseEventMask().
If a drag-and-drop operation is taking place this is a pointer to a BMessage that holds the drag information, otherwise the pointer is NULL.

briefdescription.para: Hook method called when a mouse button is released.

parameterdescription.para: The point on the screen where to mouse pointer is when the mouse button is released.

briefdescription.para: Perform some action. (Internal Method)

detaileddescription.para: This method is available to allow classes to be extended while maintaining binary compatibility.

The following perform codes are recognized:
PERFORM_CODE_MIN_SIZE:
PERFORM_CODE_MAX_SIZE:
PERFORM_CODE_PREFERRED_SIZE:
PERFORM_CODE_LAYOUT_ALIGNMENT:
PERFORM_CODE_HAS_HEIGHT_FOR_WIDTH:
PERFORM_CODE_GET_HEIGHT_FOR_WIDTH:
PERFORM_CODE_SET_LAYOUT:
PERFORM_CODE_INVALIDATE_LAYOUT:
PERFORM_CODE_DO_LAYOUT:
PERFORM_CODE_GET_TOOL_TIP_AT:
PERFORM_CODE_ALL_UNARCHIVED:
PERFORM_CODE_ALL_ARCHIVED:

parameterdescription.para: The perform code.
A pointer to store some data.

briefdescription.para: Resizes the view to its preferred size keeping the position of the left top corner constant.

simplesect.para: It is not recommended to use this method for views that are part of a BLayout.

memberdef.argsstring: (BMessage *message, int32 index, BMessage *specifier, int32 form, const char *property)
memberdef.name: ResolveSpecifier

detaileddescription.para: Determine the proper handler for a scripting message.

parameterdescription.para: The scripting message to determine the handler.
The index of the specifier.
The message which contains the specifier.
The 'what' field of the specifier message.
The name of the target property.

simplesect.para: A pointer to the proper BHandler for the given scripting message.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether or not draggers are currently drawn.

simplesect.para: true if draggers are drawn, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Hides all BDragger objects so that they're not visible on screen.

detaileddescription.para: The Hide Replicants menu item in Deskbar does its work through this method.

simplesect.para: A status code, B_OK on success or an error code on failure.

briefdescription.para: Creates a new BDragger object from the BMessage constructor.

simplesect.para: A newly created BDragger or NULL if the message doesn't contain an archived BDragger object.

briefdescription.para: Causes all BDragger objects to draw their handles.

detaileddescription.para: The Show Replicants menu item in Deskbar does its work through this method.

simplesect.para: A status code, B_OK on success or an error code on failure.

briefdescription.para: A view that allows the user drag and drop a target view.

detaileddescription.para: The target view must be its immediate relativea sibling, a parent, or single child. The target BView must be able to be archived.
The dragger draws a handle on top of the target view, usually in the bottom left the corner that the user can grab. When the user drags the handle the target view appears to move with the handle.

However the target view doesn't actually move, instead, the view is archived into a BMessage object and the BMessage object is dragged. When the BMessage is dropped, the target BView is reconstructed from the archive (along with the BDragger). The new object is a a replicant of the target view.
An example of a dragger handle on the Clock app can be seen below.
This class is tied closely to BShelf. A BShelf object accepts dragged BViews, reconstructs them from their archives and adds them to the view hierarchy of another view.
The Show Replicants/Hide Replicants menu item in Deskbar shows and hides the BDragger handles.
